page.title: 10NUTTALL'S
page.content: We were talking to Mr Paton,the manager of Nuttall's. It was built in 1972 at Kilsyth because of it's location in relation to the motorways and trunk road systems. They employ 35 workers at their Kilsyth depot, one of whom is a lorry driver. Mr Paton told us they built bridges, tunnels, dams, roads and hydro-electric schemes all over the world. Scottish projects Nuttall's have worked on include Friars Bridge, Inverness, Camphill Reservoir, Strathclyde and an aircraft servicing platform. They have had many awards,among them a Saltire award for the South Ford Causeway in Benbecula. Just now they are working on thirteen different contracts.
